name: LoggingBunyan
overview:
This class allows you interact with Stackdriver Logging through Bunyan.

First, install @google-cloud/logging-bunyan with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/logging-bunyan

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/logging-bunyanâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var logging-bunyan = require('@google-cloud/logging-bunyan')();

Elsewhere

var logging-bunyan = require('@google-cloud/logging-bunyan')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/logging-bunyan are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: LoggingBunyan
methods.description: This module provides support for streaming your Bunyan logs to Stackdriver Logging.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. Refer to this link for authentication information.

params.name: options.logName
params.description: • The name of the log that will receive messages written to this bunyan stream. Default: bunyan_Log.

params.name: options.resource
params.description: • The monitored resource that the log stream corresponds to. On Google Cloud Platform, this is detected automatically, but you may optionally specify a specific monitored resource. For more information, see the official documentation

methods.name: stream
methods.description: Convenience method that Builds a bunyan stream object that you can put in the bunyan streams list.

params.name: level
params.description: • A bunyan logging level. Log entries at or above this level will be routed to Stackdriver Logging.
